subject: Re: [junit] J2ME and JUnit
msgSnippet: You need to override the startApp() method of your MIDlet. Also, be aware that there is no reflection in JavaME, so you build your test suites differently in
messageBody:
You need to override the startApp() method of your MIDlet.

Also, be aware that there is no reflection in JavaME, so you build your test
suites differently in J2MEUnit than you do with JUnit.

--
Cedric
